matrixLib
Class ComplexNumber

java.lang.Object
  matrixLib.ComplexNumber
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<ComplexNumber>
Direct Known Subclasses:
RealNumber
public class ComplexNumber
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<ComplexNumber>

Represents a complex number, which has a real and imaginary part. This enables using matrices over the field C instead of just R.

Author:
Bryan Cuccioli

compareTo

public int compareTo(ComplexNumber z)
Compares this to z by comparing by absolute value, then by argument. This is used for sorting lists of complex numbers, when it depends only that the comparisons are consistent.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<ComplexNumber>
Parameters:
z - the complex number to compare with this
Returns:
1, -1, or 0 if the given number is greater, less, or equal, according to the above description
